page.title: 03The View from Longwood Tower
page.content: Steep hills slope down to form the Colne Valley. The view from Longwood Tower is of smoke blackened mills and houses. It is an industrial area. Most of the building is in the valley bottom. Some mills are being pulled down as the making of cloth is no longer the thriving industry it once was. Other mills are to let or used for different work. At the bottom of the valley is Crow Lane School. It is made from local stone and stands out as the stone was cleaned when the school was modernised a few years ago. Next to the school the railway goes over a long stone viaduct taking things over the Pennines to Lancashire. Running parallel to the railway is Manchester road. It is busy and noisy with traffic.A canal, which has not been used for many years runs nearby.
